abstract.p: Bill Cunningham On the Street photos of women dressing in extremes as temperatures fluctuate from 70's to under 20 degrees

block.p: Lately, fashion in New York has been a high-wire act. The seasons have been changing so fast you would think winter and spring were running a marathon. Temperatures spiraled to near 70 as January got under way, then plunged to 19 on Wednesday morning. Women scrambled to keep up with nature's high jinks, first stripping down, left, for spring's surge. On Monday, daffodils, quince, snowdrops and forsythia were in bloom in Central Park. Then, two days later, winter sprinted ahead, and women bundled up to resemble the polar bear window at the decorator Linda Horn's antiques shop on the Upper East Side. On Friday, snow coated the park and capped the daffodils.
